item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, March 13, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Amateur Telescope Making Main Page (89 points | 26 comments)
2. Mark Klein, AT&T whistleblower who revealed NSA mass spying, has died (1262 points | 256 comments)
3. Carefully but Purposefully Oxidising Ubuntu (29 points | 26 comments)
4. Ruth Belville: the "Greenwich Time Lady" who sold time from 1892 to 1940 (2022) (27 points | 5 comments)
5. Photographers Are on Mission to Fix Wikipedia's Famously Bad Celebrity Portraits (24 points | 11 comments)
6. My teen years: The transputer operating system (173 points | 25 comments)
7. Dithering in Colour (64 points | 24 comments)
8. Internet shutdowns at record high in Africa as access 'weaponised' (103 points | 45 comments)
9. The DuckDB Local UI (767 points | 165 comments)
10. Shadeform (YC S23) is hiring a senior founding engineer ( | hide)
11. Practical UX for startups surviving without a designer (292 points | 106 comments)
12. Gemini Robotics (801 points | 470 comments)
13. Show HN: Time Portal – Get dropped into history, guess where you landed (367 points | 163 comments)
14. xlskubectl – a spreadsheet to control your Kubernetes cluster (145 points | 47 comments)
15. Open source software for modeling soft materials (28 points | 6 comments)
16. Iconography of the PuTTY tools (319 points | 82 comments)
17. Reverse engineering OpenAI code execution to make it run C and JavaScript (248 points | 60 comments)
18. Peer-to-peer file transfers in the browser (520 points | 228 comments)
19. Gemma 3 Technical Report [pdf] (448 points | 232 comments)
20. The Night Watch (2013) [pdf] (155 points | 27 comments)
21. Shenmue (1999) reverse engineering reveals possible sun position oversight (155 points | 65 comments)
22. The cultural divide between mathematics and AI (242 points | 139 comments)
23. The Future Is Niri (372 points | 191 comments)
24. Are There Opportunities to Use OODA Loops in Your Software Project? (5 points | 2 comments)
25. My stupid noise journey (2023) (138 points | 153 comments)
26. Three Implementation Models for Scheme (1987) [pdf] (58 points | 4 comments)
27. Cursor told me I should learn coding instead of asking it to generate it (475 points | 309 comments)
28. Open-UI: Maintain an open standard for UI and promote its adherence and adoption (324 points | 97 comments)
29. I stopped everything and started writing C again (339 points | 342 comments)
30. 'Uber for nurses' exposes 86K+ medical records, PII via open S3 bucket (279 points | 150 comments)
